timeline.bodyText: Why not rely on Optional, rather than introducing another method which could lead to NPEs?
timeline.author: m-g-sonar

timeline.bodyText:
if this can throws a runtime exception, are we going to be able to recover from it?
It seems to me that it's not the case and it will interrupt the whole process, ultimately interrupting the analysis.
Are you sure it is working according to our failfast policy? I can't see a test recovering from it, only some test checking the thrown exception.
timeline.author: m-g-sonar

replies.bodyText: good point, I changed that it only prints warning into the log. I had to refactor unit test to use log tester
replies.author: saberduck

timeline.bodyText:
I'm really not a big fan of double-nesting lambdas. I strongly feel it does not help debugging either.
Would it be possible to just rewrite the first one in a more traditional foreach loop : for(SmapFile sm : smapFiles) { ... } and maybe extract the second big block into a dedicated method?
timeline.author: m-g-sonar

replies.bodyText: I removed the lambdas, but I don't think there is a need for dedicated method in this case
replies.author: saberduck

timeline.bodyText: What about using Optional here as well?
